sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Fileutils package contains the chgrp, chmod, chown, cp, dd, df, dir, dircolors, du, install, ln, ls, mkdir, mkfifo, mknod, mv, rm, rmdir, shred, sync, touch and vdir programs.

sect3.title: chgrp
sect3.para: chgrp changes the group ownership of each given file to the named group, which can be either a group name or a numeric group ID.

sect3.title: chmod
sect3.para: chmod changes the permissions of each given file according to mode, which can be either a symbolic representation of changes to make, or an octal number representing the bit pattern for the new permissions.

sect3.title: chown
sect3.para: chown changes the user and/or group ownership of each given file.

sect3.title: cp
sect3.para: cp copies files from one place to another.

sect3.title: dd
sect3.para: dd copies a file (from the standard input to the standard output, by default) with a user-selectable blocksize, while optionally performing conversions on it.

sect3.title: df
sect3.para: df displays the amount of disk space available on the filesystem containing each file name argument. If no file name is given, the space available on all currently mounted filesystems is shown.

sect3.title: dir, ls and vdir
sect3.para: dir and vdir are versions of ls with different default output formats. These programs list each given file or directory name. Directory contents are sorted alphabetically. For ls, files are by default listed in columns, sorted vertically, if the standard output is a terminal; otherwise they are listed one per line. For dir, files are by default listed in columns, sorted vertically. For vdir, files are by default listed in long format.

sect3.title: dircolors
sect3.para: dircolors outputs commands to set the LS_COLOR environment variable. The LS_COLOR variable is use to change the default color scheme used by ls and related utilities.

sect3.title: du
sect3.para: du displays the amount of disk space used by each argument and for each subdirectory of directory arguments.

sect3.title: install
sect3.para: install copies files and sets their permission modes and, if possible, their owner and group.

sect3.title: ln
sect3.para: ln makes hard or soft (symbolic) links between files.

sect3.title: mkdir
sect3.para: mkdir creates directories with a given name.

sect3.title: mkfifo
sect3.para: mkfifo creates a FIFO with each given name.

sect3.title: mknod
sect3.para: mknod creates a FIFO, character special file, or block special file with the given file name.

sect3.title: mv
sect3.para: mv moves files from one directory to another or renames files, depending on the arguments given to mv.

sect3.title: rm
sect3.para: rm removes files or directories.

sect3.title: rmdir
sect3.para: rmdir removes directories, if they are empty.

sect3.title: shred
sect3.para: shred deletes a file securely, overwriting it first so that its contents can't be recovered.

sect3.title: sync
sect3.para: sync forces changed blocks to disk and updates the super block.

sect3.title: touch
sect3.para: touch changes the access and modification times of each given file to the current time. Files that do not exist are created empty.
